com.google.gwt.accounts.client
Class User

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.accounts.client.User

public class User
extends java.lang.Object

Class representing state of an authenticated user session.

Constructor Detail

User

public User()
Method Detail

checkLogin

public static final java.lang.String checkLogin(java.lang.String scope)
Checks whether a cookie containing a token for the specified scope exists. Also, sets the current scope to the specified scope, so that subsequent calls to logout() and getInfo() use the new current scope. The returned token is not guaranteed to be valid, so the application must be able to handle an authorization exception when the token is used. Visit the following documentation to learn more about authenticating with AuthSubJS: http://code.google.com/apis/gdata/client-js.html#Authenticating

Parameters:
scope - URL identifying the service to be accessed.
Returns:
A token, if one exists. If no token exists for the specified scope, this method returns an empty string.

getScopes

public static final java.lang.String[] getScopes()
Returns an array of the scopes the user is currently logged into.

Returns:
The scopes the user is currently logged into.

getStatus

public static final AuthSubStatus getStatus(java.lang.String scope)
Returns the current status of the AuthSubJS process. If a scope is passed in, the method will return the status for that scope only.

Parameters:
scope - Scope argument. If specified the method will return the status for that scope only.
Returns:
The status of the AuthSubJS process.

getStatus

public static final AuthSubStatus getStatus()
Returns the current status of the AuthSubJS process.

Returns:
The status of the AuthSubJS process.

login

public static final java.lang.String login(java.lang.String scope,
                                           AuthSubSettings settings)
Retrieves a valid authentication token. This method first checks whether or not a cookie for the specified scope is already stored in the browser. If one is found, the token value is returned. If no cookie is found, a request is sent to the authentication service, which shows the user a Google Accounts Request Access page. If the user successfully logs in and grants access, then cookies containing the scope and token are stored in the client browser, and checkToken can retrieve the value of the token. Visit the following documentation to learn more about authenticating with AuthSubJS: http://code.google.com/apis/gdata/client-js.html#Authenticating

Parameters:
scope - URL identifying the service to be accessed.
settings - AuthSub parameters.
Returns:
Returns a token, keyed to a specific combination of user, client application domain, and Google service scope, or null if the scope is empty, or the token is invalid. In addition, if no valid token exists in the client browser, then the user is redirected to a Google page and invited to log into their Google account and authorize access by the web application.

login

public static final java.lang.String login(java.lang.String scope)
Retrieves a valid authentication token. This method first checks whether or not a cookie for the specified scope is already stored in the browser. If one is found, the token value is returned. If no cookie is found, a request is sent to the authentication service, which shows the user a Google Accounts Request Access page. If the user successfully logs in and grants access, then cookies containing the scope and token are stored in the client browser, and checkToken can retrieve the value of the token. Visit the following documentation to learn more about authenticating with AuthSubJS: http://code.google.com/apis/gdata/client-js.html#Authenticating

Parameters:
scope - URL identifying the service to be accessed.
Returns:
Returns a token, keyed to a specific combination of user, client application domain, and Google service scope, or null if the scope is empty, or the token is invalid. In addition, if no valid token exists in the client browser, then the user is redirected to a Google page and invited to log into their Google account and authorize access by the web application.

logout

public static final boolean logout(java.lang.Runnable callback,
                                   java.lang.String scope)
Revokes all authentication tokens for all scopes (unless a particular scope is specified as an argument or to {@link checkLogin) and deletes all authentication cookies stored by the browser. The Google service refuses subsequent requests for access until your client acquires a new token. If your client application uses multiple scopes, and you wish to log the user out of a single scope, you can pass that scope as a parameter to this method. Visit the following documentation to learn more about authenticating with AuthSubJS: http://code.google.com/apis/gdata/client-js.html#Authenticating

Parameters:
callback - A callback method to invoke after the user is logged out.
scope - A scope argument; if specified, the user will be logged out of only that particular scope.
Returns:
Returns false if user already logged out.

logout

public static final boolean logout(java.lang.Runnable callback)
Revokes all authentication tokens for all scopes (unless a particular scope is specified as an argument or to {@link checkLogin) and deletes all authentication cookies stored by the browser.
